items.title: One year since Assad was toppled, these Australians are still waiting for answers
items.summary: The US wants countries to repatriate its detained citizens from Syria. But Australia's government insists it’s "not" doing that.

items.title: Former nurse Rajwinder Singh found guilty of murdering Toyah Cordingley in 2018
items.summary: A $1 million reward was offered in late 2022 for information leading to the location and arrest of Rajwinder Singh.

items.title: Cleveland Dodd died in youth detention. Justice system 'deficiencies' are to blame
items.summary: The WA Coroner issued a range of recommendations, among them was the closure of the notorious youth detention facility, Unit 18.

items.title: Thailand launches airstrikes along disputed border with Cambodia
items.summary: Both sides are trading blame for the latest eruption in fighting along their border.

items.title: Netanyahu says phase two of Gaza peace plan nears but key disputes remain
items.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that progress toward the second phase of a US-backed plan to end the Gaza war is close.

items.title: What I didn’t expect when I used $11k from my super to freeze my eggs at 25
items.summary: After being diagnosed with a condition that can affect fertility, Libby Wilson withdrew around $11k of her super to freeze her eggs.

items.title: Kremlin praises Trump's new security strategy as closely aligned with Russia's vision
items.summary: The Kremlin offered unusually strong praise for US President Donald Trump’s new national security strategy, saying it aligns closely with Russia’s own strategic outlook.

items.title: Minister defends taxpayer-funded trips as Coalition pushes for independent review
items.summary: The communications minister is not indicating she will pay back any money as she comes under renewed fire for the cost of taxpayer-funded trips.

items.title: 'It's nasty': Could this virus spark the world's next pandemic?
items.summary: Epidemiologists are keeping a close eye on the H5 bird flu strains that are present in parts of the world.

items.title: 'At a loss': NSW bushfire victims in shock as disaster payments unlocked
items.summary: Disaster payments are now available for communities hit by bushfires across NSW, with authorities warning of ongoing risks and urging vigilance this summer.

items.title: 'That's not neutrality': Protesters call on SBS to boycott Eurovision
items.summary: Protesters have demanded SBS boycott the Eurovision Song Contest over Israel’s participation, but the public broadcaster said such a move would undermine its editorial independence.

items.title: Fears for thousands of Afghans in Australia amid 'secrecy' over potential shutdown
items.summary: Senator Fatima Payman said the Afghan embassy's closure would be 'the second fall of Afghanistan'. Insiders say it's barely been operating.

items.title: Ethel took a job in Australia to support her family. She says she was 'left with nothing'
items.summary: There are estimated to be more than 7,000 Pacific Island workers in Australia's agriculture and meat sectors at risk of exploitation.

items.title: The fake Indian wedding tying the knot between trend and tradition
items.summary: The global, growing and glamorous trend of South Asian weddings — sans bride and groom — has landed on Australian soil.

items.title: The 'everyday' behaviour that has shop owners in Australia worried — and it's on the rise
items.summary: As Christmas nears, increasing retail theft is costing profits and putting staff at risk. What's behind it?

items.title: 'A very painful day': India nightclub fire in Goa leaves 25 people dead
items.summary: A fire in a nightclub in India's tourist hot spot of Goa has killed 25 people.

items.title: Christmas lights return to Bethlehem for first time since Gaza war
items.summary: A giant Christmas tree adorned with red and gold baubles stands in the West Bank city of Bethlehem for the first time since 2022.

items.title: How a 'weaker' La Niña could impact Australia differently this summer
items.summary: La Niña is here, but not the one you're picturing. This year's event is shaping up to be "weak" — and the forecast points to a hotter, drier summer instead.

items.title: The first and only rule of 'Bite Club', the support group for shark attack survivors
items.summary: Being bitten by a shark or other predator can leave lifelong scars. One survivor started a club for those who've lived to tell the tale.

items.title: First time since 1974: Australia's FIFA World Cup 2026 opponents revealed
items.summary: The most logistically complex World Cup in history will be held across the United States, Mexico and Canada from 11 June to 19 July.

items.title: Revealed: The travel hotspots Australians are heading to this summer
items.summary: Almost three-quarters of Australians will be heading on holiday this summer — but many are choosing to stay closer to home.

items.title: Australia’s social media ban to follow teens overseas — and hit visa holders
items.summary: As Meta starts enforcing the social media ban, uncertainty grows over how the rules may affect young visitors and international students.

items.title: 'I wish I was a dog in Australia': Ex-immigration detainee speaks out as scheme investigated
items.summary: The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention is examining how the country deprives people of their liberty, from prisons to offshore detention facilities.

items.title: Israel to perform at Eurovision 2026 as Spain, Netherlands, Ireland and Slovenia withdraw
items.summary: Israel's participation has divided opinion in the contest, which has a history of entanglement in political rivalries and international issues.
